questions.question: What is the primary function of a computer processor?
Which component of a computer is responsible for executing instructions?
What does CPU stand for?
Which company is known for producing the Ryzen series of processors?
What is the purpose of a processor cache?
Which of the following is not a characteristic of a multicore processor?
What is the role of the arithmetic logic unit (ALU) in a processor?
Which technology is used to manufacture modern processors?
What does clock speed refer to in the context of a processor?
options: The speed at which instructions are executed
questions.answer: The speed at which instructions are executed

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a high-performance processor architecture?
What is the purpose of the control unit in a processor?
options: To fetch and decode program instructions
questions.answer: To fetch and decode program instructions

questions.question: What technology is used to improve the efficiency of processor performance by predicting the instructions that are likely to be executed next?
What is the purpose of the Floating Point Unit (FPU) in a processor?
Which of the following is a measure of processor performance?
What is the purpose of the System-on-Chip (SoC) architecture in modern processors?
options: To integrate multiple processing units on a single chip
To increase the clock speed of the processor
To reduce the power consumption of the processor
To improve the operating system compatibility
questions.answer: To integrate multiple processing units on a single chip

questions.question: Which component of a processor is responsible for managing the flow of data within the chip?

Which of the following is an example of a RISC processor architecture?
What is the purpose of the L1 cache in a processor?
What is the role of the Front Side Bus (FSB) in a processor?
options: To connect the processor to the memory
questions.answer: To connect the processor to the memory

questions.question: Which component of a processor is responsible for interpreting and executing program instructions?
What is the purpose of the Branch Prediction Unit in a processor?
options: To predict the next executing branch instruction
questions.answer: To predict the next executing branch instruction

questions.question: Which of the following is a measure of the efficiency of a processor?
What is the purpose of the Vector Processing Unit (VPU) in a processor?
Which technology is used to increase the performance of processors by executing multiple instructions in parallel?
What is the purpose of the Memory Management Unit (MMU) in a processor?
Which of the following is a measure of the processing power of a CPU?
What is the purpose of the Heat Sink in a processor?
options: To cool the processor by dissipating heat
To connect the processor to other components
questions.answer: To cool the processor by dissipating heat
